type: Démolition du bâtiment de Port Burwell
short_summary: Tender Notice for Demolition of a Concrete Building in Port Burwell
description: Work under this Contract shall be split into three [3] phases. The first phase will be providing access to the building a third party engineer as access points to the building have been strongly secured. As part of a separate contract the third party engineer will complete a site survey for a Designated Substance Survey (DSS). Phase one will be completed by the Contractor resecuring the building until the results of the DSS are made available. Phase 2 will be the removal and disposal of all contaminated materials as found in the results of the DSS. Phase 3 will be the complete demolition and disposal of the existing building. The building is a concrete building approximately 5.75m x 5.75m in size. Currently the door to the building has been tightly secured and will require significant effort to provide access (details and photographs can be found on the following page). Upon the completion of the DSS the building shall be stripped and emptied of all appurtenances and properly disposed of. There is an existing tower on the top of the building that must also be removed and disposed of properly. Finally the concrete building shall be demolished in its entirety and disposed of properly. The Contractor must perform and complete the Work by October 20th, 2023. ALL ENQUIRIES ARE TO BE SUBMITTED IN WRITING TO THE CONTRACTING AUTHORITY AT DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca .

full_summary:
Port Burwell Building Demolition
================================

## Tender Summary

* **Reference Number**: cb-6169-42678141
* **Solicitation Number**: 30004015
* **Publication Date**: 2023-06-05
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-06-26T14:00:00 (Expired)

## Project Overview

Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites qualified contractors to participate in a two-phase tender for the demolition of the Port Burwell building. The contract consists of three phases:

1.  Access to the building: Providing access to a third-party engineer due to strongly secured access points.
2.  Removal and disposal of contaminated materials: Removing and disposing of materials identified in the Designated Substance Survey (DSS).
3.  Complete demolition and disposal: Demolishing the existing building and disposing of its remains.

## Technical Requirements

*   The building is a concrete structure approximately 5.75m x 5.75m in size.
*   Significant effort is required to access the building, due to a tightly secured door.
*   An existing tower on the top of the building must be removed and disposed of properly.
*   The concrete building must be demolished in its entirety and disposed of properly.

## Contract Requirements

*   The contractor must complete the work by October 20th, 2023.
*   Enquiries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority at DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, with a minimum of seven (7) working days prior to the closing date.

## Attachment

The tender notice, including the Request for Qualification, can be accessed at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6169/30004015---request_for_qualification_-_services_-_two_phaseen_-_final.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6169/30004015---request_for_qualification_-_services_-_two_phaseen_-_final.pdf) (English) and [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6169/30004015_-_request_for_qualification_-_services_-_two_phasefr_-_final_%281.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6169/30004015_-_request_for_qualification_-_services_-_two_phase
